alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe; Quay; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 9:24PM MDT until July 15 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE, WEST CENTRAL QUAY AND SOUTH CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES... At 924 PM MDT, Although rain has ended over the warned area, runoff will likely continue through the next half hour with flood waters receding thereafter. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cuervo, Newkirk, Variadero, Conchas Lake State Park, Conchas and Conchas Dam. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 287 and 310. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 48 and 68...and between Mile Markers 70 and 77. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
